project.teaser: Over the past years, a great amount of knowledge on managing practices, technologies, products and recommendations in the primary sector has been developed by several EU funded projects. Despite the continuous flow of information, new or improved managing choices have not been...
project.objective: Over the past years, a great amount of knowledge on managing practices, technologies, products and recommendations in the primary sector has been developed by several EU funded projects. Despite the continuous flow of information, new or improved managing choices have not been appropriated by practitioners as expected. The main objective of NUTRI-KNOW is to broaden EIP-AGRI Operational Group (OG) outcomes on the thematic of nutrient management across borders to modernise and dynamise the agricultural sector by collecting, translating and sharing easy-to-understand and practice-oriented knowledge. NUTRI-KNOW will assure the appropriate adoption of the OGs results and experience by farmers, practitioners and other relevant end-users. To reach this ambitious goal, NUTRI-KNOW is built considering 12 EIP-AGRI OGs from 4 Member States (Spain, Italy, Belgium and Ireland), ensuring that at least one partner of the consortium has been involved in each OG. The engaged projects cover the whole value chain of nutrient management (livestock farming, storage systems, processing technologies, fertiliser production, transport and application). NUTRI-KNOW methodology is divided in 5 different steps: (1) Data collection and analysis of all the outcomes of the engaged OGs, (2) Multi-approach analysis to establish a solid baseline of the current situation (policies, farming practices, needs and challenges), (3) Consolidation and translation of the knowledge in a language that can be easy to understand for farmers and practitioners, (4) Delivery and transfer of the practice-oriented material created in the communication channels most consulted by farmers and (5) Interconnection of actors and territories with the creation of a Community of Practice. Finally, with all the knowledge gained during NUTRI-KNOW execution, the project will develop a Results Amplification Methodology that will serve as a guideline to upscale and broaden project outcomes effectively in any thematic of interest.
project.title: NUTRI-KNOW - BROADENING THE IMPACT OF EIP-AGRI OPERATIONAL GROUPS IN THE FIELD OF NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT: KNOWLEDGE EXPLOITATION AND EASY-TO-UNDERSTAND MATERIAL FOR FARMERS AND PRACTITIONERS
project.keywords: Nutrient management, Nutrient recycling, Soil management and fertilisation, Farming equipment, Value chain, Practice-oriented material, Practice abstracts, Training, Operational Group, EIP-AGRI

result.title: Inventory of current farming practices on nutrient management
result.description: This deliverable contains an inventory of current farming practices on nutrient management with the aim to broader the screening of practices beyond the 12 engaged OGs, will be created based on other EIP-AGRI OGs and EU projects who already put into practice their primary outcomes to showcase their good performance.

result.title: Meta-database after initial analyses of the OGs outcomes
result.description: This deliverable will create a meta-database after initial analyses of the OGs outcomes, which includes the individual final outcomes of each OG, current farming practices and the results of the different analysis.

result.title: Project website
result.description: This deliver will create the NUTRI-KNOW's Project website

result.title: Matchmaking of OG outcomes with market and policy
result.description: This deliver contains a matchmaking of OG outcomes with market and policy. This deliver will contextualise hte OG outcomes with the current market and legislative situation (i.e. European Green Deal, CAP, Farm to Fork, EU Fertilising Products Regulation, etc.) in terms of challenges (standarisation, collision with different policies, trends, needs of new legislation, etc.), that could directly affect their application/promotion.

result.title: Inventory and analyses of selected OGs outcomes on nutrient management
result.description: This deIiverable contains an inventory and analyses of selected OGs outcomes on nutrient management. This dynamic compilation of outcomes will be generated by 12 completed or ongoing engaged EIP-AGRI OGs identified in NUTRI-KNOW.

result.title: Report on need and barriers for user acceptance
result.description: This deliver contains a report on need and barriers for user acceptance, which will be based on an analysis to understand what are the knowledge needs and barriers for the acceptance of farmers and practitioners towards the practices addressed in the OGs

result.title: Practice Abstracts - batch I
result.description: This deliver contains a partial package of ‘practice abstracts’ for EIP-AGRI use. The package of ‘practice abstracts’ will be created following the EIP-AGRI common format for interactive innovation projects, outlining the most relevant practical recommendations for practitioners arising from the knowledge assimilation and facilitating the connection with other EIP-AGRI OGs. This deliver contains 15 practice abstracts

result.title: Mapping of stakeholders and target audience
result.description: This deliverable contains a mapping of stakeholders and target audience, based on the identification of the stakeholders that have an interest and/or influence over the results identified in the field of nutrient management in the EU.

result.title: 6 Booklets on nutrient management
result.description: This delivereable will create 6 Booklets on nutrient management based on the content produced in the OGs whihc will be translated from a technical language into a direct and easy understandable language to be easily understood by all types of end-users.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - NUTRI-KNOW (NUTRI-KNOW - BROADENING THE IMPACT OF EIP-AGRI OPERATIONAL GROUPS IN THE FIELD OF NUTRIENT MANAGEMENT: KNOWLEDGE EXPLOITATION AND EASY-TO-UNDERSTAND MATERIAL FOR FARMERS AND PRACTITIONERS)
result.teaser: In recent years, numerous EIP-AGRI Operational Groups (OGs) have generated extensive knowledge on technologies, products, recommendations, and best practices in nutrient management. Despite this, the adoption of these innovations by practitioners in the agri-livestock sector...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: DEC Master Plan
result.description: This deliver contains a Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Master Plan which will outline the multi-layer activities to maximise the impact of the project results.

category.title: animal husbandry
category.displayCode: /agricultural sciences/animal and dairy science/domestic animals/animal husbandry

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
